oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pvt. Andrew J. Northrop, Co. H, 17th Indiana Vol., USA, correspondence
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Pvt. Andrew J. Northrop to his siblings. Northrop enlisted in Co. H, 17th Indiana Vol., USA, on Feb. 18, 1864, and mustered out on Apr. 29, 1865. In the letter, he tells his family that he is well and weighs "one hundred and eighty pounds." He asks that they tell his nieces and nephews that he loves them and will come see them "after this war is over." He also asks his sister to collect money from his father and "Solyman" to send to him or he "must sell my wife and children out of a home."
